title: Distributed test fix
body_html: test_distributed.py fails when world_size is set to something > than NGPU's you have locally. Unless you only have 1 GPU. For example it fails if you have 2 GPU's by default with run_tests.sh because default world_size is 3. This PR will have it skip the multi-gpu tests when world_size > device_count
body_text: test_distributed.py fails when world_size is set to something > than NGPU's you have locally. Unless you only have 1 GPU. For example it fails if you have 2 GPU's by default with run_tests.sh because default world_size is 3. This PR will have it skip the multi-gpu tests when world_size > device_count
body: `test_distributed.py` fails when `world_size` is set to something > than NGPU's you have locally. Unless you only have 1 GPU. For example it fails if you have 2 GPU's by default with run_tests.sh because default world_size is 3. This PR will have it skip the multi-gpu tests when `world_size > device_count`
